title: BUG SPLAT AFTER CHAMP SELECT?
body: I updated my windows yesterday and decided to open up league. After champ select the client closed, as usual. Screen went black for a moment, as usual. But the instant after, I got bugsplatted. I closed the game and tried again. After several failed attempts I decided to let it go. Unfortunately, waiting didn't help. I now have low priority queue due to the amount of times I attempted to play a game and got bugsplatted. Any ideas on what I should do? Anyone else having the same problem?

replies.body: I am having the same problem. I have tried all recommended fixes from the site and even tried a fresh install - nothing is working.

We've had a number of reports from players that after recent windows updates, their display resolution is different that before. This has been causing these bugsplats in a lot of cases, so I recommend lowering your display resolution using [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/4910-screen-resolution-display-change-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves the issue.

Let me know if this helped.
Thanks for helping me out. I changed the resolution to the normal 1920x1080 but I'm still having the same issue.

Sorry about that, it seems I left out a step. I'd like you to complete a reset of your config folder in your League directory. The steps below will help you do this.

First,  **log into the game** then jump into **a custom game**. *Alt+Tab* out of the match, then navigate to your installation directory, which should be here:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

>*Delete* the folder called **CONFIG**

Once you've deleted the Config folder, leave the custom match, then hop into another to confirm the changes went through. Let me know if this helped resolve the issue.
Thank you for helping me out. The problem was the windows update. It set the xbox recording thing to on.
